availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Princeton, Caldwell County, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Rebecca Morse Williams in Caldwell County, Kentucky on December 28, 1833. Father of John A. Williams, James J. Williams, Keziah J. Williams, Nancy K. Williams, Mary A. Williams, Robert Williams, and Elizabeth Williams. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned twenty-two enslaved persons in Caldwell County, Kentucky in 1850.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 575. Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film 000851644, p. 59. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 820.
